---
  title: Smoothing!
---

<div id="smoothing" class="section level1">
<h1>Smoothing</h1>
<p>It can be hard to view trends with just points alone. Many times we wish to add a smoothing line in order to see what the trends look like. This can be especially helpful when trying to understand regressions.</p>
<p>We will take out scatter plot and apply a smoothing line to this:</p>
<pre class="r"><code>ggplot(data, aes(x=distance, y= dep_delay)) + 
        geom_point() +
        geom_smooth()</code></pre>
<p>Again, the smoothing line comes after our points which means it is another layer added onto our graph:</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," width="672" /></p>
<p>Note that the <code>geom_smooth()</code> function adds confidence bands on the smooth as well. We can remove these by adding <code>se=FALSE</code> inside the <code>geom_smooth()</code> function:</p>
<pre class="r"><code>ggplot(data, aes(x=distance, y= dep_delay)) + 
        geom_point() +
        geom_smooth(se=FALSE)</code></pre>
<p>This produces the following plot:</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," width="672" /></p>

<div class="content-box-green">
<h1>
On Your Own
</h1>
<p>Consider what happens when you switch the layers around.</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: decimal">
<li>Graph just the data step:</li>
</ol>
<pre><code>ggplot(data, aes(x=distance, y= dep_delay))</code></pre>
<ol start="2" style="list-style-type: decimal">
<li>Then add just the smooth</li>
</ol>
<pre><code>ggplot(data, aes(x=distance, y= dep_delay)) + 
    geom_smooth()</code></pre>
<ol start="3" style="list-style-type: decimal">
<li>Finally add the points in:</li>
</ol>
<pre><code>ggplot(data, aes(x=distance, y= dep_delay)) + 
    geom_smooth() + 
    geom_point()</code></pre>
<p><strong><em>Note what happens as you slowly build these layers. This is a major part of the power of <code>ggplot2</code></em></strong></p>
</div>

<div id="varying-the-smooth" class="section level2">
<h2>Varying the Smooth</h2>
<p>We have so far just seen how to add the smooth without being able to do anything but add or subtract the confidence bands. We now will change the smoothness of our smooth that we added. To do so we add <code>span=__</code> inside the <code>geom_smooth()</code> layer:</p>
<pre class="r"><code>ggplot(data, aes(x=distance, y= dep_delay)) + 
        geom_point() +
        geom_smooth(span = 0.1)
ggplot(data, aes(x=distance, y= dep_delay)) + 
        geom_point() +
        geom_smooth(span = 1)</code></pre>
<p>Above shows the coding for 2 possibilities of these changes to the smooth.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," width="672" /></p>
<p>Note that with <code>span = 0.1</code> we have a more rough smoothing than we had previously.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," width="672" /></p>
<p>When we changed the <code>span = 1</code> we can see that this is much smoother. The <code>span</code> can be varied from 0 to 1, where 0 is very rough and 1 is very smooth.</p>
</div>
<div id="different-types-of-smooths" class="section level2">
<h2>Different Types of Smooths</h2>
<p>There are different types of smooths that we can do. We will consider:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>loess</code></li>
<li><code>gam</code></li>
</ul>
<div id="loess-smooths" class="section level3">
<h3>Loess Smooths</h3>
<p>Loess smoothing is a process by which many statistical softwares do smoothing. In <code>ggplot2</code> this should be done when you have less than 1000 points, otherwise it can be time consuming.</p>
<pre class="r"><code>ggplot(data, aes(x=distance, y= dep_delay)) + 
        geom_point() +
        geom_smooth(method=&quot;loess&quot;)</code></pre>
<p>As you can see with the code we just add <code>method=&quot;loess&quot;</code> into the <code>geom_smooth()</code> layer.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," width="672" /></p>
</div>
<div id="gam-smoothing" class="section level3">
<h3><code>gam</code> Smoothing</h3>
<p><code>gam</code> smoothing is called generalized additive mode smoothing. It works with a large number of points. We specify this by adding <code>method=&quot;gam&quot;, formula = y~s(x)</code> into the <code>geom_smooth()</code> layer.</p>
<pre class="r"><code>library(mgcv)
ggplot(data, aes(x=distance, y= dep_delay)) + 
        geom_point() +
        geom_smooth(method=&quot;gam&quot;, formula = y ~s(x))</code></pre>
<p>The code for this is very similar and we can see how it looks below:</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," width="672" /></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
